sections.text: Northwestern’s MPH prepares public health professionals to advance population health through interdisciplinary training in epidemiology, biostatistics, policy, and community health.

items: Core courses in epidemiology, biostatistics, environmental health, and policy
Applied practice experience and culminating project
sections.text: The program combines foundational public health coursework with specializations and applied experiences culminating in a capstone.

items: Completion of required credits and practice components
sections.text: Students meet credit and experiential requirements aligned with program policies; flexible scheduling options may be available.
Graduates work in public health agencies, healthcare systems, NGOs, research institutions, and policy organizations.
